DOC.brief_summary: Background objective : To determine efficacy non-invasive positive pressure ventilation ( NPPV ) effect upon intubation rate mortality ARDS .
DOC.brief_title: Non-Invasive Positive Pressure Ventilation Adult Respiratory Distress Syndrome ( ARDS )
DOC.detailed_description: Methods : This study perform respiratory intensive care unit ( ICU ) university hospital . 20 patient achieve diagnostic criterion ARDS include . The patient prospectively allocate two group : standard therapy group NPPV group . Invasive mechanical ventilation indication determine study . Invasive ventilation apply need intubation , give intubation receive standard medical treatment .
DOC.criteria: The following criterion indicate immediate intubation need : 1 . Apne respiratory pause loss consciousness gasp breath imminent respiratory arrest . 2 . Inability increase patient 's PaO2 40 mmHg SpO2 80 % FiO2 > 0.6 . 3 . Inability increase patient 's pH level 7.35 , development blur consciousness confusion ( Glasgow Coma Scale < 9 ) due respiratory acidosis despite support give . 4 . Instability patient 's hemodynamic parameter ( systolic blood pressure < 80 mmHg heart rate < 50 beats/minute last > 1 hour despite fluid resuscitation ) . Contraindications NPPV include : 1 . The need urgent intubation . 2 . The need frequent aspiration due excessive secretion ( frequent 15 min. ) . 3 . Inability patient adapt / device unwillingness undergo NPPV .
